intro: Sarcocephalus junghuhnii, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and alternate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, hard seeds. Sarcocephalus junghuhnii is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and rocky areas.
